awd_titl_txt: Kinetic and Modeling Studies of Low Pressure CVD Reactor to Establish the Dominent Reaction Regimes
awd_abstract_narration: This planning grant, submitted in conjunction with the Minority                 Research Initiation program of the NSF, is to define reaction                   mechanisms through laboratory experimentation and mathematical                  modeling, and thereby determine the contributions that gas phase                and surface reactions can make in controlling thickness and                     uniformity in low pressure chemical vapor deposition (LPCVD)                    processes.  The LPCVD process has the capability to deposit films of            good thickness uniformity.  This feature makes LPCVD a most                     attractive process to be used in step coverage for integrated circuit           applications.  The transport phenomena effect on deposition rates               (thickness) and uniformity can be determined if the reaction kinetic            effects are better established.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers
